intro: Sisymbrium leptophyllum, commonly known as slender yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are slender and pinnately divided, giving the plant its common name.
